page.title: 09Dicker Day- a Carnival.
page.content: Upper Dicker Day started in the 60's then it vanished for at least twenty years . Then one summer they had a carnival and retitled it Dicker Day. It is held in July on the village field.In the morning the floats go to Michelham Priory to be judged. When the floats are judged they are driven to the village field. On the village field there are lots of stalls like book stalls, white elephant stalls, refreshment stalls ect. Later in the afternoon there is a dressing up competition and the winner gets his/her picture taken, and you get a rosette. For the side shows they had mini rollercoaster, bouncing castle, smash the crockery, lunar lander, treasure island, fish the bottle, and tombola.There are lots of children's events like sack race, egg and spoon race, piggy back race and running
